required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Social Media Use of Acne Vulgaris Patients: Multicenter, Survey Work
clinical_study.official_title: Social Media Use of Acne Vulgaris Patients: Multicenter, Survey Work

brief_summary.textblock: Acne Vulgaris is a chronic skin disease. However, chronic and repetitive due to the quality of life and psychological status of patients can affect. For this reason, patients carry out various research on their diseases on social media and follow programs on these issues in other media such as television and radio. However, there is no study on how much patients are interested in these publications, how much they trust them, and how they reach and organize information via social media. The aim of the study will be to clarify how and how patients with Acne Vulgaris use social media to obtain information about the diagnosis and treatment of their disease, the interaction of patient groups with each other, and how often social media is used, especially in which group of patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Social media use of acne vulgaris patients, a questionnaire will be asked the patients and try to learn how they use social media for getting information about their disease.

intervention.description: Social media use of acne vulgaris patients, a questionnaire will be asked the patients and try to learn how they use social media for getting information about their disease.

study_pop.textblock: acne vulgaris patients between 12-60 years of age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- acne vulgaris patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- who does not want to answer the questions
